intro: Aniba hypoglauca, commonly known as the yellow-eyed elder, is a small evergreen tree native to the rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and clusters of small, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer, followed by orange-red berries. Its leaves and bark contain various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in ethnobotanical research. Aniba hypoglauca thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
